source.title: Prepare and pH the HBSS,  M199 and EMEM solutions

source.description:
1. Prepare the HBSS, M199, and EMEM solutions outlined in step 1 – Stock Media Preparation table using the following directions:
  2. Dispense 9L of Milli-Q (18mΩ) water in to the carboy
  3. Store overnight at 4°C to allow to come to temperature.
  4. Using the stirrer add the media powder to the water and allow to go into solution.
  5. Add the powdered supplements and penicillin/Streptomycin to the appropriate media based on the table (step 1) and allow to stir into solution.
  6. Stir the solution for 30 min
  7. Store the prepared solution overnight at 4°C to allow all powders to go into solution
  8. Stir the solution for 30 min
  9. Calibrate the pH meter using the buffer controls
  10. Adjust the pH level to 7.4 using the NaOH and/or HCl solutions.
  11. Bring to volume with the appropriate amount of Milli-Q water.

source.title: Filter sterilize the HBSS, M199 and EMEM solutions

source.description:
1. Sterile filter using the peristaltic pump, the tubing (silicon 25 gauge) and the capsule filter (Nylon Capsule filter 0.22µm membrane)  into the appropriate sterilized media bottle.
  2. Store the filtered media at 4°C until needed for supplementation prior to isolation.

source.title: Prepare, pH and filter sterilize the 1M Nicotinamide solution

source.description:
1. Dispense 0.9L of Milli-Q water in to the carboy.
  2. Store overnight at 4°C to allow to come to room temperature.
  3. Using the stirrer add the reagent powder into the water based on the table (Step 4) and allow to stir into solution.
  4. Stir the solution for 30 min
  5. Calibrate the pH meter using the buffer controls
  6. Adjust the pH level to 7.4 using the NaOH and/or HCl solutions
  7. Bring to volume (1L) with the appropriate amount of Milli-Q water.
  8. Filter sterilize using a bottle top filter (0.22μM) into a sterile 1L bottle.
Label prepared solutions with designated name (if applicable), Record ID, date, and initials.
Prepare the gradient collection tubes and density gradient solutions tubes as outlined in step 6 "collection".

• Prepare immediately prior to the isolation start as follows
  • Aseptically reconstitute the DNase I, Grade II (Roche cat# 10104159001) by adding 4ml of perfusion solution to the DNase powder (activity on calf thymus - 2993 u /mgL) contained in the manufacture glass bottle.
  • Allow the DNase to go into solution on ice for 30 minutes

• Weigh 20 mg of dithizone (Sigma - cat# 43820) into a 50mL conical tube.
  • Dissolve dithizone in 6mL of DMSO (Fisher Scientific - Cat# BP231) in a 50mL conical and mix.
  • Dilute DMSO-dithizone with HBSS to 40ml total volume
  • Transfer DMSO-dithizone solution to a 60cc syringe with 45µm nylon filter, ready for use.
  • Fill another 60cc syringe with ~50mL of HBSS, ready for use as a diluent.

Equally as important to collagenase is Neutral Protease. The choice of NP is usually associated with the choice of collagenase. That is, if Liberase MTF C/T is the collagenase of choice, Thermolysin comes in a kit of three NP vials per two vials of Liberase. Vitacyte provides their neutral protease as a seperate product (catalog # 002-L000).
Prepare the Neutral Protease solution immediately prior to the isolation start as follows
  • Aseptically reconstitute the by adding 10ml of perfusion solution to the non-specific Neutral Protease powder
  • Allow the Neutral Protease to go into solution on ice for 30 minutes
  • Store on ice until addition to the collagenase solution based upon the protease concentration (lot dependent) and pancreas weight.
Prepared culture media and priming solution as described in step 6 are stored at room temperature prior to usage. All remaining solutions are stored at 2-8°C until usage.

Collagenase choice is critical in a successful islet isolation. It has been established that GMP high grade collgenase blends such as Liberase MTF C/T (Roche cat# 0533988001) or CIzyme Collagenase HA (Vitacyte Cat#: 001-1000) are reliable products for high yield quality human islet isoaltions. Alternately, a less pure but more cost effective product like Collagenase Gold 800 (Vitacyte cat# 011-1060) has shown to be very effective for research only human islet isoaltion.
Prepare the Collagenase solution immediately prior to the isolation start as follows.
  • Aseptically reconstitute the white lyophilized cake (collagenase) contained in the supplier bottle by adding 30ml of perfusion solution.
  • Allow the collagenase to go into solution on ice for 30 minutes
  • Bring the resulting collagenase solution to 350ml volume using perfusion solution.
  • Store on ice until perfusion

source.title: Preparation and use of Dithizone stain in Islet Preparations.

source.description:
Preparation of dithizone
  1. Weigh out 0.2g of dithizone powder into a 50ml conical tube.
  2. Add 6mls of DMSO and mix until the powder is in solution.
  3. Bring the resulting dithizone solution to 40ml total volume with HBSS and mix.
  4. Transfer the dithizone solution to a 60cc syringe with a 0.45µm nylon filter.
  6. Use
  7. For every ml of islet suspension add an equal amount of the prepared dithizone solution must be added to the sample.
  8. For visualization of staining add another 2mls of HBSS to dilute the stain and reduce the background colour.
  9. Alternately, 100µl of islet suspension, 100µl dithizone and 200µl HBSS.
Use
  1. For every ml of islet suspension add an equal amount of the prepared dithizone solution must be added to the sample.
  2. For visualization of staining add another 2mls of HBSS to dilute the stain and reduce the background colour.
  3. Alternately, 100µl of islet suspension, 100µl dithizone and 200µl HBSS.
